subject: RE: [junit] Pattern based description of jUnit's swingui?
msgSnippet: Not that I know of. My experience extending the framework has taught me that that beyond the basic classes you ve already read about, design went out the
messageBody:
Not that I know of. My experience extending the framework has taught me that
that beyond the basic classes you've already read about, design went out the
window. Don't even look for model-view separation. You won't find it here.
What did you have in mind?

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com

> -----Original Message-----
> From: noneofyer42businessbub [mailto:a.adachi@...]

> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Pattern based description of jUnit's swingui?
>
>
> Is there any kind of documentation out there which describes the
> design of
> jUnit's swingui implementation (and how it connects to framework) in
> terms of
> patterns like in "JUnit A Cook's Tour"?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Anthony Adachi
